simulated_ratings.title: Barry Lyndon (1975)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Milanese drift and marital ennui rendered with elegant chill—Antonioni’s cool void that I relish.

simulated_ratings.title: L'Eclisse (1962)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Geometric alienation and hollowed romance—an exquisite freeze-frame of modernity’s emotional eclipse.

simulated_ratings.title: Le Trou (1960)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ascetic escape mechanics and brotherly rigor—pure procedural absorption with moral chill.

simulated_ratings.title: Classe Tous Risques (1960)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Terminal‑cool Melville: glassy heist geometry and moral frost that I savor at a slight remove.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Ceremonial sorrow and moral steel—severe, flowing, and devastating in cool currents.
